Travelport global survey highlights different digital traveler habits

08 Nov 2017

81% use online reviews when researching their journey

43% want to switch off when away, but 60% lost without a smartphone

16 app categories are typically used on a trip

Read the full press release

Recent news

06 Nov 2017

Press release library

The view from Travelport

Comment, opinion and thought leadership

  •

    Meeting the accommodation needs of the corporate traveler

    Hotel booking is big business and according to Euromonitor International, hotel booking value is projected to grow from $480 billion in 2013 to $600 billion in 2017.

    Read more about Meeting the accommodation needs of the corporate traveler

  • What matters to millennial business travelers?

    In recent years everyone has been talking about millennial travellers and their influence on the travel industry. This group, now between the age of 18 and 34, will soon become the largest group of travel customers.

    Read more about What matters to millennial business travelers?

  • How today’s traveler has shaped the evolution of travel

    Today’s travelers are super connected, including during their trip, with many valuing free in-room WiFi as a must-have amenity.

    Read more about How today’s traveler has shaped the evolution of travel

  • When will the FinTech revolution reach B2B payments?

    Why, when it comes to B2B payments, have we yet to see the kind of technological revolution currently shaking up the consumer payments world?

    Read more about When will the FinTech revolution reach B2B payments?

  • Bloomberg Radio’s “The First Word” interview with Gordon Wilson

    Gordon Wilson is interviewed on global travel industry issues and on Travelport’s business model during “The First Word,” Bloomberg Radio’s flagship breakfast program.

    Read more about Bloomberg Radio’s “The First Word” interview with Gordon Wilson

  • Adopting the mobile mind-set: mobile technology in corporate travel

    Mobile isn’t a trend, it’s a mind-set. The majority of us live our lives through mobile devices and apps so we expect the companies we purchase goods and services from to understand this and make our lives easier.

    Read more about Adopting the mobile mind-set: mobile technology in corporate travel

  • Travelport’s Niklas Andreen named on Buying Business Travel Hotlist

    The annual Hotlist showcases people, companies and products which are making an impact on business travel.

    Read more about Travelport’s Niklas Andreen named on Buying Business Travel Hotlist

  • Travelport’s Gordon Wilson celebrates 20 years of GTTP student education

    The Global Travel and Tourism Partnership (GTTP), a business and education alliance, is celebrating 20 years of success.

     

    Read more about Travelport’s Gordon Wilson celebrates 20 years of GTTP student education

  • THIS is the year of mobile payments

    The increasing sophistication of mobile payments is a key stimulus for travel companies. 

    Read more about THIS is the year of mobile payments

  • The future of business travel spend and trends for Europe

    The business travel sector needs to evolve to address new trends, and demonstrate innovation in order to succeed. 

    Read more about The future of business travel spend and trends for Europe

  • Looking back and seeing ahead

    Travelport recaps 2015 and looks at 2016 industry trends.

    Read more about Looking back and seeing ahead

  • e-volve summit in Venice

    OTA's take center stage at Travelport's e-volve summit in Venice, November 2015

    Read more about e-volve summit in Venice

  • Technology Business of the Year

    A great win at TTG Awards  – September 2015

    We went through a major re-branding process, floated on the New York Stock Exchange and launched a number of industry-leading products.

    Read more about Technology Business of the Year

  • Travelport has the edge

    The Beat article – August 2015

    Travelport claims merchandising parity with Lufthansa’s direct website.

    Read more (pdf) about Travelport has the edge

  • Converting searchers into customers

    What are the services that enhance travelers’ experience and lead to greater conversion rates?

    Read more about Converting searchers into customers

  • Staying relevant to tech-savvy travelers

    How corporate travel buyers can embrace technology to offer greater choice and customer service to corporate travelers.

    Read more about Staying relevant to tech-savvy travelers
